result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deanthony Marquez Tripp-Smith

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 13 pages) commencing 10-03-2022 by Amy Wallow.

Defendant Deanthony Marquez Tripp-Smith not in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Deanthony Marquez Tripp-Smith.  Attorney Elaine Fehrs on behalf of Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defense bail hearing held.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies bail motion.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and SPEEDY jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Exp. 1/3/2023

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 41:
Defendant Deanthony Marquez Tripp-Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Deanthony Marquez Tripp-Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Bryant-Povletich. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 41.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deanthony Marquez Tripp-Smith not in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Deanthony Marquez Tripp-Smith.  Attorney Elaine Ferhs on behalf of Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defense bail motion held.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record Court denies defense's bail motion.  Case remains calendared for Preliminary Hearing on 10-3-2022 at 1:30 pm, by zoom.

Defendant Deanthony Marquez Tripp-Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court in person for Deanthony Marquez Tripp-Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness was not present at the time hearing was called. Defense Counsel unable to wait. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defense Counsel requests to be heard on bail.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Deanthony Tripp-Smith - #2022009067, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Deanthony Marquez Tripp-Smith in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Deanthony Marquez Tripp-Smith in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with ETB, her residence, her workplace or anywhere else she temporarily occupies.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Deanthony Marquez Tripp-Smith in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Deanthony Marquez Tripp-Smith in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deanthony Marquez Tripp-Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 1, 2, 5, 6 and 7. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Br 41.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Deanthony Marquez Tripp-Smith
Current: 3856 N 25th St, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 07-25-2022)
Prior: 4244 North Teutonia Avenue, #34, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
